encodingDesc.p: Some small changes to the original transcriptions were made including fixed spelling errors and getting rid of parentheses, brackes, and colons.

body.stage: Open Ext. Damaged space station, likely in another dimension
The sky is purple and tumultuous as the sounds of Rick and Morty running and panting are heard.
Trans. Int. Space station
Rick and Morty run through the abandoned station, pursued by evil clones of Jerry, Beth, and Summer.

sp.speaker: Rick
sp.p: Run!

body.stage: The three clones tackle Rick, knocking a device from his hand. Morty stands by, unsure of what to do.

sp.speaker: Rick
sp.p: Morty, do it! Hit the button now!

sp.speaker: Morty
sp.p: I can't do it, Rick! They're my parents and sister!

sp.speaker: Rick
sp.p: holding off the clones Morty, I already told you, it's not your family! They're clones from an alternate reality possessed by demonic alien spirits from another dimension's future! Do you need a mnemonic device or something? Just hit the button already!

body.stage: Beth's clone leaves Rick and approaches Morty, panting viciously until she gets close, and she seemingly becomes her normal self again.

sp.speaker: Beth
sp.p: Morty, please. I love you, sweetheart.

sp.speaker: Morty
sp.p: Ohhhh...

body.stage: Morty hesitates a second longer before darting past Beth. He glances up at the clones, then covers his eyes as he hits a button on the wall, creating an energy field that destroys the clones, whose faces seem to melt. Morty watches, horrified. As soon as they're gone, Rick jumps to his feet and grabs the device that absorbed the spirits, apparently unbothered by the entire event.

sp.speaker: Rick
sp.p: Good work, Morty.

body.stage: He creates a portal and jumps through.
Trans. Garage
Rick and Morty leap through the other end of the portal back to the Smith residence.

sp.speaker: Rick
sp.p: holding up the device and smiling Y-You know, these demonic alien spirits are really valuable!

body.stage: Screen pans out to show that Morty is vomiting in the corner. Rick glances at him and puts the box away.

sp.speaker: Rick
sp.p: You okay, Morty? Told you not to trust that tuna.

sp.speaker: Morty
sp.p: I just killed my family! I don't care what they were!

sp.speaker: Rick
sp.p: I dunno, Morty. Some people would pay top dollar for that kinda breakthrough.

sp.speaker: Morty
sp.p: Y-You know what, Rick? That's it! I-I'm done with these...insane adventures! That was really traumatizing! I quit! I'm out!

body.stage: Morty turns and starts to walk out of the garage.

sp.speaker: Rick
sp.p: Whoa whoa whoa, grabs Morty's shoulder, stopping him come on, Morty! D-D-Don't be like that! The universe is a crazy and chaotic place!

sp.speaker: Morty
sp.p: pushes Rick's hands away You're the one that's crazy and chaotic! Adventures are supposed to be simple! And fun!

sp.speaker: Rick
sp.p: Oh yeah, Morty. Yeah, t-t-that- that's real easy to say from the sidekick position. Butâ€”But, uh, h-how about next time you be in charge, then we'll talk about how simple and fun it is.

sp.speaker: Morty
sp.p: suddenly excited Seriously Rick?! Y-You'll let me call the shots?

sp.speaker: Rick
sp.p: Okay, fine. But let's make it interesting, Morty. I-I-If your adventure sucks, and we bail halfway through it, you lose the right to bitch about all future adventures. Plus, you have to do my laundry for a month.

sp.speaker: Morty
sp.p: Okay, all right, tough guy! But if my adventure's good... I get to be in charge of every third adventure!

sp.speaker: Rick
sp.p: Every 10th.

sp.speaker: Morty
sp.p: Deal. All right. Well, come on, let's get going.

sp.speaker: Beth
sp.p: Dad, the dishwasher's doing that thing again.

sp.speaker: Rick
sp.p: Washing dishes?

sp.speaker: Beth
sp.p: No. The opposite. Can you fix it?

sp.speaker: Summer
sp.p: Grandpa Rick, can you help me with my science homework?

sp.speaker: Rick
sp.p: Yeah just don't do it.

sp.speaker: Summer
sp.p: Grandpa!

sp.speaker: Jerry
sp.p: Hey, Rick, you got some kind of hand-shaped device that can open this mayonnaise jar?

sp.speaker: Rick
sp.p: Wow. Hat trick. All right, Morty, let's put a pin in this. I got to help your pathetic family.

sp.speaker: Morty
sp.p: Oh, that sounds like something a chicken would say. Bawk, bawk, bawk, bawk, bawk, bawk.

sp.speaker: Rick
sp.p: Oh, Morty, you done did it this time. It's on. I can't wait to watch your adventure lay a huge fart. As for you dingdongs... This is a Meeseeks box. Let me show you how it works. You press this.

sp.p: I'm Mr. Meeseeks! Look at me!

sp.speaker: Rick
sp.p: You make a request. Mr. Meeseeks, open Jerry's stupid mayonnaise jar.

sp.speaker: Meeseeks
sp.p: Yes, siree!

body.stage: Meeseeks grabs mayonnaise jar as rick explains.

sp.p: The Meeseeks fulfills the request.

body.stage: Meeseeks opens jar and hands to jerry.

sp.speaker: Meeseeks
sp.p: All done!

sp.speaker: Jerry
sp.p: amazed Wow!

sp.p: And then it stops existing.

sp.speaker: Summer
sp.p: Oh, my God, he exploded!

sp.speaker: Beth
sp.p: So many possibilities.

sp.p: My mind is racing.

sp.p: I'm Mr. Meeseeks!

sp.speaker: Meeseeks
sp.p: Ooh, okay!

sp.speaker: Jerry
sp.p: Summer, what did I just-

sp.speaker: Meeseeks 2
sp.p: Ooh, I'm Mr. Meeseeks! Look at me!

sp.speaker: Beth
sp.p: I want I want to be a more complete woman!

sp.speaker: Jerry
sp.p: Beth!

sp.speaker: Meeseeks 2
sp.p: Oh, yeah! Yes, ma'am!

sp.speaker: Jerry
sp.p: You guys are doing it wrong. He said "simple."

sp.speaker: Meeseeks 3
sp.p: Hey, there. I'm Mr. Meeseeks!

sp.speaker: Jerry

sp.speaker: Meeseeks 3
sp.p: Ooh, yeah! Can do!

body.stage: Cut to Rick and Morty in a poor village somewhere in the universe. It looks like a place from the 1700's

sp.speaker: Rick
sp.p: God, Morty, what a boring start to an adventure. Why didn't we just go to Kentucky?

sp.speaker: Morty
sp.p: Rick, this is a fantasy-type world with creatures and all sorts of fantasy things. We're going on a quest, okay?

sp.speaker: Rick
sp.p: Can't wait.

body.stage: Morty stands on something tall to speak to the people

sp.speaker: Morty
sp.p: Ahem. Excuse me! We are two humble heroes in search of adventure!

sp.speaker: Rick
sp.p: Oh, my God, so embarrassing.

sp.speaker: Villager man
sp.p: At last! Two heroes! You must help us! This village is terribly poor, yet the giant that lives in the clouds above has untold treasures!

sp.speaker: Morty
sp.p: You know what? I accept your call to adventure, good sir, kind sir. Come on, Rick. There's a giant in the clouds!

sp.speaker: Rick
sp.p: Yeah. Beginner's luck.

body.stage: Cut to Meeseeks 1 speaking to the students of Summer's school in the gym

sp.speaker: Meeseeks 1
sp.p: In conclusion, a friendship with Summer Smith is the most valuable and enriching experience of your young lives. I'm Mr. Meeseeks! Look at me! Thank you!

sp.speaker: Principal Gene V.
sp.p: Uh, Mr. Meeseeks, was it? Yeah. Gene Vagina. Listen, I'm in a bit of custody thing with my ex and was wondering- Meeseeks 1 stops existing- No, I'll get your info from Summer.

body.stage: Cut to Beth and Meeseeks 2 at a restaurant sitting outside

sp.speaker: Beth
sp.p: I got pregnant at 17. I mean, I still put myself through veterinary school. Yes, I'm successful, but what if I hadn't...-Meeseeks 2 stares attentively- I'm just saying, somewhere along the way, I lost that wide-eyed girl from muskegon.

sp.speaker: Meeseeks 2
sp.p: She's still there, Beth.

sp.speaker: Beth
sp.p: Well, her waistline isn't.

sp.speaker: Meeseeks 2
sp.p: Beth, having a family doesn't mean that you stop being an individual. You know the best thing you can do for people that depend on you? Be honest with them, even if it means setting them free.

sp.speaker: Beth
sp.p: You're saying I should leave Jerry. Beth starts to cry I can't believe I'm finally having this conversation.

body.stage: Meeseeks 2 stops existing as Beth leans in to kiss him

sp.speaker: Waiter man
sp.p: More wine?

sp.speaker: Beth
sp.p: I think I've had enough.

body.stage: Cut to Jerry at a golf course with Meeseeks 3

sp.speaker: Meeseeks 3
sp.p: Remember to square your shoulders, Jerry.

sp.speaker: Jerry
sp.p: Yeah, yeah. I got it.

body.stage: Jerry misses the ball completely

sp.speaker: Meeseeks 3
sp.p: That's okay. I'm Mr. Meeseeks! Look at me! Try again and keep your head down.

sp.speaker: Jerry
sp.p: Okay, well, which is it? Square my shoulders or keep my head down?

sp.speaker: Meeseeks 3
sp.p: Well, it's both. But most importantly, you got to relax.

sp.speaker: Jerry
sp.p: You know what, Mr. Meeseeks? I don't think this is working. I give up.

sp.speaker: Meeseeks 3
sp.p: I'm sorry, Jerry, but it doesn't work like that. I'm Mr. Meeseeks. I have to fulfill my purpose so I can go away. Look at me.

sp.speaker: Jerry
sp.p: Well, make yourself comfortable, because I suck.

sp.speaker: Meeseeks 3
sp.p: No, Jerry, I'm the one who SUCKS! Let me try something.

body.stage: Meeseeks 3 spawns in another Meeseek

sp.speaker: Meeseeks 4
sp.p: I'm Mr. Meeseeks! Look at me!

sp.speaker: Meeseeks 3
sp.p: Hi, Mr. Meeseeks! I'm Mr. Meeseeks! Look at me.

sp.speaker: Meeseeks 4
sp.p: Hi!

sp.speaker: Meeseeks 3
sp.p: Can you help me get two strokes off of Jerry's golf swing?

sp.speaker: Meeseeks 4
sp.p: Can do! I'm Mr. Meeseeks! Is he keeping his shoulders squared?

sp.speaker: Meeseeks 3
sp.p: Ooh, he's trying!

body.stage: Cut to Rick and Morty on a table in a giant building

sp.speaker: Rick
sp.p: All right, Morty. We're in your stupid giant's castle. What do we do next?

sp.speaker: Morty
sp.p: Would you just relax, Rick? All we got to do is find the treasure room, okay? It's nice and simple. You know, I'm sorry everything's going so smoothly and adventurously.

body.stage: A giant can be heard walking down the hall

sp.speaker: Rick
sp.p: sarcasticUh-oh, Morty. Startin' to get a little hairy. What do you want to do, boss?

sp.speaker: Morty
sp.p: Come on, hurry. Behind this cookie jar.

sp.speaker: Giant
sp.p: Fee! Fi! Fo! Fum!

sp.speaker: Rick
sp.p: Just give up, Morty. This is game over. I'll take us home right now. You just say the word.

sp.speaker: Morty
sp.p: No way, Rick. This is all part of it. Adventures have conflict. Deal with it.

sp.speaker: Giant
sp.p: I smell the blood of- whoop!the giant falls and cracks his head open on the table corner before hitting the ground

sp.speaker: Morty
sp.p: Holy crap.

sp.speaker: Rick
sp.p: Oh, boy. He looks pretty bad down there, Morty. Looks like he's bleeding out.

body.stage: A giant woman walks in holding a baby

sp.speaker: Giant woman
sp.p: Oh, Jesus! Dale! You sons of bitches! Oh, man. Hello, 911? My husband has been attacked by tiny people! He's dying!

body.stage: Cut to Rick and Morty at a giant jail and getting mug shots

sp.speaker: Detective
sp.p: Hey, look, we get it. You're little, you're down on your luck, you think, "hey, he's a giant. Why don't we break into his home, rob him, and murder him?"

sp.speaker: Morty
sp.p: Th-th but that's not how it went down!

sp.speaker: Detective
sp.p: Oh, well, it's going down like that. You're both going down like that.

sp.speaker: Rick
sp.p: Ooh, boy, Morty, you're really showing me how it's done. Real straightforward and fun.

body.stage: Cut to the Smith dinning room and living room where Jerry is still frustrated, while Summer and Beth look much happier

sp.speaker: Summer
sp.p: Like, letting go of the need to be popular is what makes people like you.

sp.speaker: Beth
sp.p: The most important love you can receive is from yourself.

body.stage: Several meeseeks now fill the livingroom, trying to help

sp.speaker: Meeseek
sp.p: Okay, Jerry, you got to just choke up on the club!

sp.speaker: Jerry
sp.p: Well, which is it, choke up or follow-through?!

sp.speaker: Meeseek
sp.p: Aww, come on, Jerry, we've been over this. You know you got to do both! This is as frustrating for us as it is for you.

sp.speaker: Jerry
sp.p: Don't tell me that! That just puts pressure on me!

sp.speaker: Meeseek
sp.p: Just try to relax.

sp.speaker: Jerry
sp.p: You try to relax! Have you ever tried to relax?! It is a paradox! Jerry walks to the dinning room Ugh, these Meeseeks, huh? Kind of a handful. I can't imagine what you two must be going through.

sp.speaker: Beth
sp.p: Our Meeseeks have been gone for hours, Jerry.

sp.speaker: Jerry
sp.p: You're kidding me.

sp.speaker: Beth
sp.p: Notice anything different?

sp.speaker: Jerry
sp.p: I'm sorry. Hours?

sp.speaker: Summer
sp.p: Dad, mom is a beautiful woman! Look at her! You will lose her!

sp.speaker: Meeseek
sp.p: Uhh... Hey, Jerry, you mind if we get back to the task at hand? Meeseeks don't usually have to exist this long. It's getting weird.

body.stage: Cut to Rick and Morty in a giant courthouse

sp.speaker: Judge
sp.p: Order in the court! Before the jury reaches its verdict, I just want to say that I consider you both very guilty.

sp.speaker: Rick
sp.p: sarcasticOh, great adventure, buddy. Rick and Morty go to giant prison. You know, if somebody drops the soap, it's gonna land on our heads and crush our spines, Morty. You know, it'll be really easy to rape us after that.

sp.speaker: Morty
sp.p: We're gonna be okay, Rick.

sp.speaker: Rick
sp.p: How? They took my portal gun. This is an open-and-shut case, Morty. You know, what do you think's gonna happen, some magical angel's gonna show up and then-the court doors burst open and a giant in a suit walks down the isle.

sp.speaker: Giant Lawyer
sp.p: Fee! Fi! Fo! Fum! I smell the violation of civil liberties! Your honor, I'm from a tiny-persons advocacy group and I have here in my hand a motion to dismiss. These little men were never read their giant rights and are therefore free-fi to fo-home.

body.stage: Murmers of confusion spread throughout the court

sp.speaker: Rick
sp.p: W-what the hell is he talking about?

sp.speaker: Giant Lawyer
sp.p: They're free to go, is what I meant. I'm deconstructing our our our thing we say. We're giants. Nobody got that? Whatever.

sp.speaker: Morty
sp.p: Oh, man, what did I tell you, Rick? We did it!

body.stage: Rick and Morty appear outside the courthouse

sp.speaker: Rick
sp.p: All right, Morty, looks like the portal gun's still working. You ready to head home?

sp.speaker: Morty
sp.p: Oh, yeah, you'd like that, wouldn't you, Rick? Well, you know what? We're not bailing out just yet. You know, we're gonna go find some treasure or something and and we're gonna bring it to those villagers.

sp.speaker: Rick
sp.p: Morty, cut your losses. This is obviously awash.

sp.speaker: Morty
sp.p: Yeah, you were saying that back when we first got arrested, but here we are, you know, walking down the courthouse steps.

body.stage: They look down the stairs and see that each step is as tall as a large building. The stairs seem to go on forever

sp.speaker: Rick
sp.p: Oh, boy, Morty.

sp.speaker: Morty
sp.p: Usually, walking down the courthouse steps is the easy part of the adventure.

sp.speaker: Rick
sp.p: What do you say, Morty?

sp.speaker: Morty
sp.p: I say give me a hand, sidekick.

body.stage: Cut to the Smith livingroom. Dozens of meeseeks fill the room whinning, groaning and desperatly trying to help Jerry.

sp.speaker: Jerry
sp.p: Everybody shut up! Let me try! Jerry swings and misses again Damn it! Damn it! Damn it!

sp.speaker: Beth
sp.p: I'm going out.

sp.speaker: Jerry
sp.p: Wait. What?

sp.speaker: Beth
sp.p: Well, you're busy. I'm hungry. I thought I'd go out. Do you want me to be happy or do you want me to be in prison?

sp.speaker: Jerry
sp.p: Whoa, whoa, where in the hell is, I'll take you to dinner.

sp.speaker: All the Meeseeks
sp.p: AWWWWWWW!

sp.speaker: Jerry
sp.p: Hey, you know what? It's hard being me, too. I'll be right there. Look, I've got a marriage to keep together. At this point, my golf swing is more your problem than mine.

body.stage: Exit Beth and Jerry

sp.speaker: Meeseek
sp.p: I can't take it anymore. I just want to die!

sp.speaker: Meeseek (diff)
sp.p: We all want to die! We're Meeseeks! Why did you even rope me into this?

sp.speaker: Meeseek (diff)
sp.p: 'Cause he roped me into this!

sp.speaker: Meeseek (diff)
sp.p: Well, him over there, he roped me into this!

sp.speaker: Meeseek (diff)
sp.p: Well, he roped me into this!

sp.speaker: Meeseek (diff)
sp.p: Well, what about me? He roped me into this.

sp.speaker: Meeseek (diff)
sp.p: Well, that one over there roped me into this.

sp.speaker: Meeseek (diff)
sp.p: Well, he roped me into this.

body.stage: Cut to Rick and Morty climbing down a step like it's a mountian

sp.speaker: Rick
sp.p: Yeah, Morty, this is the part of the story everybody loves scaling down 650,000 oversized steps.

sp.speaker: Morty
sp.p: All right, okay, you know, if this was a story, this part wouldn't be included, stupid. They see an opening in one of the steps Hey, Rick, what do you know? Look down there. Looks like some kind of tavern or something built right into the side of the step.

body.stage: Rick and Morty appear in the tavern

sp.speaker: Morty
sp.p: Oh, wow, Rick. Now, this is more like it. Look, there's little staircase-shaped people in here. All kinds of crazy characters. This place is great, you know? It's whimsical and fun.

body.stage: Rick sees a creature staring at him

sp.speaker: Rick
sp.p: What are you looking at, mother-

sp.speaker: Morty
sp.p: Easy, Rick.

body.stage: A strange looking waitress with large boobs greets them at their table

sp.speaker: Waitress
sp.p: Pay them no mind. Those stair goblins can be moody. Now, what can I getcha? We've got skarlog poppies, flurlow, halzingers, bloogies, juicy time babies.

sp.speaker: Rick
sp.p: Yeah, yeah, yeah, how about some scotch whiskey? You got any of that around here? Or just a bunch of nonsense words?

sp.speaker: Morty
sp.p: Rick... We'll have two bloogies, please. And, uh, we were wondering, is there a faster way two heroes could get down these stairs?

sp.speaker: Slippery
sp.p: Y'all need to ride down the stairs? My name is slippely-slippery stair. I'll take you down there for 25 shmeckels.

sp.speaker: Rick
sp.p: 25 shmeckels? I don't know how much I don't know what that is. Is that a lot? Is it a little?

sp.speaker: Waitress
sp.p: That's exactly how much I spent on my big fake boobies.

sp.speaker: Mr. Booby Buyer
sp.p: Hi, I'm Mr. Booby Buyer. I'll buy those boobies for 25 shmeckels.

sp.speaker: Waitess
sp.p: It's a tempting offer, but I'm gonna have to decline.

sp.speaker: Mr. Booby Buyer
sp.p: Rats! What a shame.

sp.speaker: Rick
sp.p: Morty, your adventure's in a spiral. For real, man, time to pull out.

sp.speaker: Morty
sp.p: You keep heckling my adventure, Rick! You know why?

sp.speaker: Rick
sp.p: Uh, because it's lame?

sp.speaker: Morty
sp.p: It's because you're petty! You know, how many times have I had to follow you into some nonsensical bull crap? I always roll with the punches, Rick. Why can't you? Look, I got to take a leak, and when I come back, if you haven't learned how to lighten up, don't be here!

sp.speaker: Rick
sp.p: Whatever.

body.stage: Cut to the Smith livingroom with all the Meeseeks

sp.speaker: Meeseek
sp.p: It's become clear-look at me- that if we concentrate all our efforts on Jerry's follow-through, we will solve this problem. I'm Mr. Meeseeks.

sp.speaker: Meeseeks *
sp.p: I'm Mr. Meeseeks. Look at me. The only thing that's clear is that choking up is the one true solution.

sp.speaker: Meeseeks 3
sp.p: Look at me. I'm Mr. Meeseeks. I've been trying to help Jerry for two days, an eternity in Meeseeks time, and nothing's worked. I fear the worst.

sp.speaker: Meeseeks
sp.p: Your failures are your own, old man. I'm Mr. Meeseeks! Look at me. I say follow-through! Who's with me?! Follow-through!

body.stage: A Meeseek spawns in another Meeseek

sp.speaker: New Meeseek
sp.p: I'm Mr. Meeseeks! Look at me!

sp.speaker: Meeseek
sp.p: Kill him!

sp.p: Hisssss! He attacks another meeseek

body.stage: Cut to Morty in the bathroom

sp.speaker: Mr. Jelly Bean
sp.p: How are you today? I'm Mr. Jelly Bean!

sp.speaker: Morty
sp.p: Hi, Mr. Jelly Bean. I'm Morty. My grandpa and I are on an adventure.

sp.speaker: Mr. Jelly Bean
sp.p: Nice. Is it a fun adventure?

sp.speaker: Morty
sp.p: I hope so. But I'm starting to get nervous that maybe it's gone a little too far off the rails.

sp.p: Well, isn't that what adventures do?

sp.p: Hey, you know what? You're right. Everything's going fine. I just got to relax and go with the flow.

sp.speaker: Mr. Jelly Bean
sp.p: Yeah.

sp.p: Okay. Uh. B-bye.

sp.p: Uhh, no, stay. Go with the flow!

sp.p: Stop. You're making me really uncomfortable.

sp.p: aggresiveStop fighting me! Just let this happen!

sp.p: Get off of me!

sp.p: Whoo! No! Stop! Please!

sp.p: Stop being such a tease, you sweet little-

Back at the Smith house even more Meeseeks have spawned and a full out battle has started. However, even the badly hurt Meeseeks cannot die because the have not completed their task

sp.speaker: Meeseek
sp.p: Everybody sto-o-o-p! Look at me! My brothers, nothing will be accomplished by shedding Meeseeks blood. None of us can die until our job is done.

sp.speaker: Meeseek (diff)
sp.p: The job can't be done! We'll never get two strokes off his game!

sp.speaker: Meeseek
sp.p: No, we won't. But we will get all strokes off his game.

sp.speaker: All other Meeseeks
sp.p: Where's he going with this? What's he mean?

sp.speaker: Meeseek
sp.p: When we kill him!

sp.speaker: Beth
sp.p: Jerry, maybe it's time I take that trip I always talk about.

sp.speaker: Jerry
sp.p: Where would you go?

sp.speaker: Beth
sp.p: I don't know, man. Italy. Greece. Argentina.

sp.speaker: Jerry
sp.p: Countries known for their sexually aggressive men. Did I tell you how much I love your new haircut?

sp.speaker: Jerry
sp.p: What the heck?

sp.speaker: Meeseek
sp.p: There he is!

sp.speaker: Beth
sp.p: Run, Jerry!

sp.speaker: Meeseek
sp.p: Come on out, Jerry!

sp.speaker: Jerry
sp.p: Guys, I'll choke up. I'll follow through. I'll do whatever you tell me to do, okay?
